head.note: This manuscript record does not have a summary list of contents. For composite manuscripts, the list of contents can be found under each individual part.

listRelation.desc: This composite manuscript consists of 15 distinct parts:

altIdentifier.collection: William Wright, Catalogue of the Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838
William Wright, Catalogue of the Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

head.note: This manuscript contains: Portions of both parts of a Choir-book, comprising Psalms xlv.—lxxxii., which were chanted before the altar at the celebration of the holy Eucharist. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 3 items.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.title: Portions of both parts of a Choir-book, comprising Psalms xlv.—lxxxii., which were chanted before the altar at the celebration of the holy Eucharist.
The first part (ܐ)
msItem.note: Of the first part there remain: Ps. xlviii. 5—xlix. 10; l. 23—lv. 12; lxi. 2— lxvi. 11; lxix. 17—lxxi. 15; lxxvi. 2— lxxvii. 10; and lxxx. 10—lxxxi. 11.

msItem.title: The second part (ܒ)
msItem.note: Of it there remain: Ps.xlv. 1—xlvi. 5; xlviii. 3—lvi. 9; and lxxxii. 6—8.

physDesc.p: Twenty-one paper leaves, about 6 1/2 in. by 4 7/8, most of which are more or less stained and torn. The quires are signed with letters. There are from 13 to 15 lines in each page.

item.p: Twenty-one paper leaves, about 6 1/2 in. by 4 7/8, most of which are more or less stained and torn. The quires are signed with letters. There are from 13 to 15 lines in each page.

handNote.desc: The writing is large and regular, and dated A. Gr. 1559, A.D. 1248.

item.p: On fol. 21 a there is a note, giving the date, and saying that this manuscript was written by a "feeble old man," aided by Rabban Habīb. The scribe seems therefore to have been the same Bacchus who wrote Add. 17,256 .

p.quote: ܫܠܡ̣ܘ ܐܝܟ ܒܟܬܐ ܕܕܝܪ̈ܝܐ ܩܕܝ̈ܫܐ ܕܒܕܝܪܐ ܕܣܘܪ̈ܝܝܐ ܡܙܡܘܪ̈ܐ ܕܡܙܡܪܝܢ ܩܕܡ ܡܕܒܚܐ ܒܥܕܢܐ ܕܩܘܪܒܐ. ܕܩ̇ܪܐ ܢܨ̇ܠܐ ܥܠ ܣܒܐ ܡܚ̣ܝܠܐ ܕܣ̣ܪܛ ܘܥܠ ܪܒܢ ܚܒܝܒ ܕܥ̇ܕܪ. ܘܥܠ ܟܠ ܕܐܫܬܘܬܦ. ܗ̈ܘܝ ܗܠܝܢ ܫܢܬ ܐܠܦ ܘܢ̇܏ܢܛ ܕܝ̈ܘܢܝܐ ܢܟܝ̈ܠܐ.

recordHist.source: Manuscript description based on Wright's Catalogue , abbreviated by the Syriaca.org editors.

bibl.author: William Wright
bibl.title: Catalogue of Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

altIdentifier.collection: William Wright, Catalogue of the Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838
William Wright, Catalogue of the Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

head.note: This manuscript contains: Large portions of the second part of a Choir-book, containing the Psalms, according; to the Peshitta version. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 5 items.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.title: Large portions of the second part of a Choir-book, containing the Psalms, according; to the Peshitta version
msItem.note: We have here: part of Ps. xvii.; xxiv. 4—xxvi.12; xxviii. 2— xxxi. 7; xxxii. 2—xxxiv. 2; xxxv. 20— xxxvii. 20; xii. 4—xliv. 2; xiv. 13—xlvii. 1; xlviii. 13—xlix. 18; li. 15—liii. 1; lv. 9— lvi. 2; lix. 5—Ixii. 10; lxv. 1—lxviii. 4; lxviii. 26—lxix. 34; lxxi. 12—xcv. 3; xcviii. 9—cii. 22; civ. 24—cv. 12; cviii. 2—cxviii. 24; and cxviii. 61—87
The ܡܪ̈ܡܝܬܐ and ܫܘܒ̈ܚܐ are marked, and the verses divided by ܗ. The commencements of the various daily services are also rubricated in the text.

msItem.title: Part a
Part b
Part c
Part d

physDesc.p: Paper, about 6 7/8 in. by 5 1/4, consisting of 52 leaves (Add. 17,257, foll. 22—73), most of which, are more or less stained and torn. The quires are signed with letters. The number of lines in each page varies from 11 to 15.

item.p: Paper, about 6 7/8 in. by 5 1/4, consisting of 52 leaves (Add. 17,257, foll. 22—73), most of which, are more or less stained and torn. The quires are signed with letters. The number of lines in each page varies from 11 to 15.

handNote.desc: This manuscript is written in a rather inelegant hand of the xiiith or xivth cent., with a few Greek vowels.

additions.note: N.B., folio location may not be available for some items below.

note.p: Portions of the Psalms: lix. 2.—lxii. 7, and Pss. ci. 1—cii. 17.
There are no marginal annotations of any kind.

bibl.author: William Wright
bibl.title: Catalogue of Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

interpretation.p: Description is based on Wright's Catalogue without consultation of physical manuscripts. Foliation is approximate. Wright often does not indicate ending folia so those have been assumed based on beginning folia.
Scribal notes which could not be more clearly classified based on Wright's descriptions have been identified as <addition>s whether they occur in the margins or the body of the manuscript.
In general, we have classified as an <msItem> as much of the manuscript contents as possible, including tables of contents and indices.

category.catDesc: Catenae Patrum and Demonstrations against Heresies
Councils of the Church and Ecclesiastical Canons

langUsage.language: Unvocalized Syriac of any variety or period
Arabic Garshuni in Vocalized West Syriac Script
Arabic Garshuni in Vocalized East Syriac Script

revisionDesc.change: CHANGED: added or corrected folio extent values
ADDED: added missing locus information for msItems
CHANGED: updated incorrect form and/or material support designation
